page.title: 02COUNTRY LIFE - A SCHOOLGIRL
page.content:
A day in my life begins at 8.30 Saturday morning and I have just woken up. I get dressed,washed and have my breakfast, then set off for my music lesson at 9.15am. Mum has to take me as usual although I sometimes cycle. An hour later Mum picks me up and then drops me in town. I stay in Colchester for two hours and then return home. In the afternoon I go riding on my pony. There is little else to do in this area. I never go out much because everywhere is too far away and I have to rely on my parents to take me. Although it is peaceful and there's nobody to bother you, the evenings are boring with nothing to do and sometimes I wish I lived nearer my friends where there is more to do. Teresa O'Boyle
Elmscombe Farm
